wetlandCH4prod.comment: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

lwsffluxaero.comment: downwelling longwave  flux  due to volcanic aerosols at the surface to be diagnosed through double radiation call

lwtoafluxaerocs.comment: downwelling longwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call

swsffluxaero.comment: Shortwave heating rate due to volcanic aerosols to be diagnosed through double radiation call

swtoafluxaerocs.comment: Downwelling shortwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call

cLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLeaf.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

cSoilFast.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilFast.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in fast soil pool. Fast means a lifetime of less than 10 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

cSoilMedium.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilMedium.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in medium (rate) soil pool. Medium means a lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

cSoilSlow.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilSlow.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in slow soil pool. Slow means a lifetime of more than 100 years for reference climate (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

fFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fFire.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

fGrazing.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fGrazing.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land

fLitterSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fLitterSoil.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

fVegLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegLitter.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.

fVegSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegSoil.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area from vegetation directly into soil, without intermediate conversion to litter.

mrfso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrfso.comment: The mass per unit area (summed over all model layers) of frozen water.

nppLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppLeaf.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

nppRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppRoot.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

nppWood.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppWood.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP

rGrowth.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rGrowth.comment: Growth respiration is defined as the additional carbon cost for the synthesis of new growth.

rMaint.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rMaint.comment: Maintenance respiration is defined as the carbon cost to support the metabolic activity of existing live tissue.

dmc.comment: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

edt.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies
Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

evu.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies
Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

mcd.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mcu.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.

rldcs.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rldcs4co2.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rldcs.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs4co2.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

smc.comment: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

tnhusa.comment: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection
Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

tnhusd.comment: Tendency of specific humidity due to numerical diffusion.This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

Tendency of specific humidity due to numerical diffusion.This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

tnhusmp.comment: Tendency of specific humidity due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physics.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

Tendency of specific humidity due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physics.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

tnhusscpbl.comment: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing  (to be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all boundary layer terms including and diffusive terms.)

Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing  (to be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all boundary layer terms including and diffusive terms.)

tnta.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection
Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

tntscpbl.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing (to be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.)

Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing (to be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.)

airmass.comment: The mass of air in an atmospheric layer.

aoanh.comment: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (0 ppbv), uniform fixed source (at all levels) everywhere else (source is unspecified but must be constant in space and time and documented). Note that the source could be 1yr/yr, so the tracer concentration provides mean age in years. For method using linearly increasing tracer include a method attribute: 'linearly increasing tracer'For method using uniform source (1yr/yr) include a method attribute: 'uniform source'

c2h2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

c2h6.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

c3h6.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

c3h8.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

cdnc.comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds.

ch3coch3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction 'mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. Acetone is an organic molecule with the chemical formula CH3CH3CO. The IUPAC name for acetone is propan-2-one. Acetone is a member of the group of organic compounds known as ketones. There are standard names for the ketone group as well as for some of the individual species.

chepsoa.comment: If model lumps secondary organic aerosol (SOA) emissions with primary organic aerosol (POA), then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as OA emissions. Here, mass refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

co.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

dms.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

drybc.comment: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

drydust.comment: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

drynh3.comment: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

drynh4.comment: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

drynoy.comment: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3 aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

dryo3.comment: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

dryoa.comment: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic dry aerosol due to dry deposition: This is the sum of dry deposition of primary organic aerosol (POA) and dry deposition of secondary organic aerosol (SOA). Here, mass refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.  We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called dry_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

dryso2.comment: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

dryso4.comment: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

dryss.comment: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

emico.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emianox.comment: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

eminox.comment: NOx=NO+NO2. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emioa.comment: This is the sum of total emission of primary organic aerosol (POA) and total production of secondary organic aerosol (SOA) (emipoa+chepsoa). Here, mass refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.

emibc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emibvoc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field._If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

emidms.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiisop.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

emilnox.comment: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_nox_from_lightning

eminh3.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiso2.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiso4.comment: Direct primary emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiss.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emivoc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

hcho.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

isop.comment: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

lwp.comment: The total mass of liquid water in cloud per unit area.

mmraerh2o.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. 'Ambient_aerosol' means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. 'Ambient aerosol particles' are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

mmrbc.comment: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.

mmrdust.comment: Dry mass fraction of dust aerosol particles in air.

mmrnh4.comment: Dry mass fraction of ammonium aerosol particles in air.

mmroa.comment: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.

mmrpm1.comment: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 1 micrometers

mmrpm10.comment: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 10 micrometers

mmrpm2p5.comment: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers

mmrso4.comment: Dry mass of sulfate (SO4) in aerosol particles as a fraction of air mass.

mmrsoa.comment: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of secondary organic aerosols (particulate organic matter formed within the atmosphere from gaseous precursors; dry mass).

mmrss.comment: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of sea salt aerosol (dry mass).

nh50.comment: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (100ppbv), uniform fixed 50-day exponential decay.

no.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

o3loss.comment: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,...)

o3prod.comment: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k*[HO2]*[NO])

od550bb.comment: total organic aerosol AOD due to biomass burning (excluding so4, nitrate BB components)

od550oa.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to organic aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550soa.comment: Total organic aerosol AOD due to secondary aerosol  at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550bc.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to black carbon aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550lt1aer.comment: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  (ambient here means wetted). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

od550no3.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to nitrate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550so4.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550ss.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to sea salt aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

pan.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

pod0.comment: Accumulated stomatal ozone flux over the threshold of 0 mol m-2 s-1; Computation: Time Integral of (hourly above canopy ozone concentration * stomatal conductance * Rc/(Rb+Rc) )

ptp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

reffclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius as seen from space over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere (TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

so2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

tatp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

ttop.comment: cloud_top refers to the top of the highest cloud. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

wa.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward_air_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.

wetbc.comment: Surface deposition rate of black carbon (dry mass) due to wet processes

wetdust.comment: Surface deposition rate of dust (dry mass) due to wet processes

wetnh3.comment: Surface deposition rate of ammonia (NH3) due to wet processes

wetnh4.comment: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

wetnoy.comment: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3 aerosol, NO3 (radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

wetoa.comment: Deposition rate of organic matter in aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

wetso2.comment: Deposition rate of sulfur dioxide due to wet processes

wetso4.comment: Deposition rate of sulfate aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

wetss.comment: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

ztp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

agessc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
agessc.comment: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.

agessc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
agessc.comment: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.

bigthetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetao.comment: Sea water conservative temperature (this should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field)

bigthetaoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetaoga.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

bigthetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetao.comment: Sea water conservative temperature (this should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field)

bigthetaoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetaoga.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

bsios.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bsios.comment: sum of particulate silica component concentrations

dpco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpco2.comment: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.

dpco2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpco2abio.comment: Difference in partial pressure of abiotic-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

spco2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
spco2abio.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, an 'abiotic analogue' is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

dpco2nat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpco2nat.comment: Difference in partial pressure of natural-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

spco2nat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
spco2nat.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a 'natural analogue' is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

dpo2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dpo2.comment: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

fbddtalk.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtalk.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity

fbddtdic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdic.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon

fbddtdife.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdife.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron

fbddtdin.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdin.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

fbddtdip.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdip.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of phosphate

fbddtdisi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fbddtdisi.comment: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate

fddtalk.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtalk.comment: vertical integral of net time rate of change of alkalinity

fddtdic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdic.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Dissolved inorganic carbon' describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. 'Dissolved inorganic carbon' is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. The list of individual species that are included in a quantity having a group chemical standard name can vary between models.  Where possible, the data variable should be accompanied by a complete description of the species represented, for example, by using a comment attribute.

fddtdife.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdife.comment: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron

fddtdin.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdin.comment: Net time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

fddtdip.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdip.comment: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate

fddtdisi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (top 100m only) time: mean
fddtdisi.comment: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate

fgcfc11.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

fgcfc12.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

fgdms.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgdms.comment: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

fgo2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fgo2.comment: Gas exchange flux of O2 (positive into ocean)

fgsf6.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

ficeberg.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

ficeberg2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg2d.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

frfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
frfe.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.

fric.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

friver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
friver.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

frn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
frn.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.

froc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

fsfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fsfe.comment: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc

fsn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fsn.comment: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).

hfbasin.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasin.comment: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasin.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasin.comment: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasinpadv.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpadv.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasinpmadv.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpmadv.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasinpmdiff.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpmdiff.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

hfbasinpsmadv.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpsmadv.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfcorr.comment: Flux correction is also called 'flux adjustment'. A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') .

hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') .

hfevapds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hfevapds.comment: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'

hfibthermds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  ' Iceberg thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

hfibthermds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  ' Iceberg thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

hflso.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hflso.comment: This is defined as with the cell methods string: where ice_free_sea over sea

hfrainds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hfrainds.comment: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.

hfrunoffds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.

hfrunoffds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds2d.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.

hfsifrazil.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsifrazil.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Frazil' consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.

hfsifrazil2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsifrazil2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Frazil' consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.

hfsnthermds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'Snow thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

hfsnthermds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'Snow thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

hfx.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfx.comment: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfy.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfy.comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

htovgyre.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
htovgyre.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

htovovrt.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
htovovrt.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

icfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
icfriver.comment: Inorganic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

intdic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intdoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intparag.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbp.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpbsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpcalcite.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpn2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

intpp.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intpp.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.

intppcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppcalc.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the calcareous phytoplankton component alone

intppdiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppdiat.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone

intppdiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppdiaz.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophs alone

intppmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppmisc.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

intppnitrate.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intppnitrate.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton based on nitrate uptake alone

intpppico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
intpppico.comment: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton component alone

limfecalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfecalc.comment: 'Calcareous phytoplankton' are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfediat.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfediaz.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfemisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfemisc.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfepico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limfepico.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limirrcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrcalc.comment: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrdiat.comment: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrdiaz.comment: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrmisc.comment: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limirrpico.comment: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limncalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limncalc.comment: 'Calcareous phytoplankton' are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limndiat.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limndiaz.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limnmisc.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
limnpico.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

masso.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
masso.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

masso.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
masso.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

mfo.comment: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport.

mlotstsq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotstsq.comment: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by 'temperature', 'sigma', 'sigma_theta', 'sigma_t' or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer.

o2min.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
o2min.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean.  A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

obvfsq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
obvfsq.comment: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called 'buoyancy frequency' and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.

ocfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocfriver.comment: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

pbo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
pbo.comment: 'Sea water pressure' is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

pso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
pso.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  'Sea water pressure' is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

rsdo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsdo.comment: Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'.  When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'.  In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'.  In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  'shortwave' means shortwave radiation.

rsntds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsntds.comment: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

sfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfriver.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.

sfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfriver.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.

sltovgyre.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

sltovovrt.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
sltovovrt.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

so.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
so.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

soga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
soga.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sob.comment: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell

spco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
spco2.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

tauucorr.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

tauuo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

tob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

vsfpr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfpr.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

vsfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

vsfsit.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfsit.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

wfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfcorr.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*.

wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*.

wfonocorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfonocorr.comment: Computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wmo.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
wmo.comment: Upward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.

wo.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward).
A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward).

zsatarag.comment: Depth of aragonite saturation horizon (0 if undersaturated at all depths, 'missing' if supersaturated at all depths; if multiple horizons exist, the shallowest should be taken).

zsatcalc.comment: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if undersaturated at all depths, and missing saturated through whole depth; if two or more horizons exist, then the shallowest is reported)

latitude.comment: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

bs550aer.comment: Aerosol  Backscatter at 550nm and 180 degrees, computed from extinction and lidar ratio
